question.title: Glob *.* not working on paths with unicode in Java and macOS?
question.body:
It seems Java's glob path matcher isn't matching some unicode symbols as shown in this jshell session:

$ jshell
|  Welcome to JShell -- Version 24
|  For an introduction type: /help intro

jshell>  var matcher = java.nio.file.FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher("glob:*.*")
   ...>
matcher ==> sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystem$1@2328c243

jshell>  matcher.matches(new java.io.File("Article.md").toPath())
   ...>
$2 ==> true

jshell>  matcher.matches(new java.io.File("üóûÔ∏è Article.md").toPath())
   ...>
$3 ==> false

Is this a Java bug or is there a reasonable explanation for this? This problem only seems to be there on macOS. On Windows and linux both expressions return true for me.
